title.narrative: Empowerment of civic control over corruption in public procurement in Belarus

description.narrative: According to SYMPA /BIPART public procurement remains one of the most significant sources of corruption in Belarus because more than 5 bln USD of public financing is annually allocated to this field. Public controlling bodies are obviously involved into th e corruption deals and civic control over it is limited. Civil society does not have working tools to influence both to the public opinion and to the decisions related to corruption. Journalists or researches who have courage to write about corruption are isolated do not have enough knowledge or experience in running investigations and do not have peers with whom to share the experience.In 2015 SYMPA/BIPART launched the Open Tenders project. The site www.opentenders.by draws data from the government?s offic ial state procurement website and makes it accessible to the public. In 2016 with the support of Finnish local funding a special fraud search tool was introduced two policy papers on the thematics was published and an animation on how much the country loos es as a result of corruption was created.The objective of the new project is to empower the civil society in Belarus in its fight against corruption in public procurement through building a community of investigators who a able to influence in public opini on with quality investigations on existing corruption. The empowering of the civil society and building community of researches includes: encouraging and educating journalists and researches watchdog-NGOs and ordinary citizens to write more and better on p ossible corruption cases to educate them to use he open tenders -tool and to instruct them to promote their results with the help of petitions. At the same time the community of journalists and researches will exchange experience and information share sour ces and network with each other.
